data.title: A Quiz on Serial Killers
data.meta_description: A Quiz on Serial Killers - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
2. William E. Cook Jr. was an American serial killer notorious for murdering six motorists within a span of 22 days. Posing as a hitchhiker, Cook used to take lift and kill people, thereby inciting a fear among the motorists to not take any hitchhiker with them. Cook was executed in 1952, but the legend hanged on. So much so that in 1972 one rock band made a song about a killer on a roll. Which song?

3. “Riders on the Storms” by The Doors. Jim Morrison wrote the lines: “There’s killer on a roll… If you give this man a ride, sweet family will die …” taking an inspiration from Robert Cook.

4. Robert Doob was a sexual predator and serial killer from Pacific Palisades, California. A grocery deliveryman by profession, he was finally killed by one Karen McCann, when he tried to rape her. Kiefer Sutherland played the role of Doob in the Hollywood original, but we shall always shiver whenever we think of his teeka-sporting Bollywood counterpart. Which villain?

5. Gopal Pandit from Dushman The Hollywood original was An Eye for an Eye (1996)

6. Rajendra Jakkal, Dilip Sutar, Shantaram Kanhoji Jagtap and Munawar Harun Shah were four commercial art students at the Abhinav Kala Mahavidyalaya, Pune. Between January ‘76 and March ‘77, they murdered ten people and started a reign of terror in the city. Captured in 1977 and hanged in 1983, the Joshi-Abhayankar Murder Case (as it was popularly known) has once again came into news more recently . What being the reason?

7. It was the only instance of four convicts together being hanged before the hangings of Nirbhaya killers happened in March, 2020.

8. When authorities raided Ed Gein’s household in 1958, they were horrified to discover dead bodies stacked, body parts scattered. Even Human skins were found scavenged to make lampshade and chairs. There was abominable living conditions inside, except of his mother’s room which was pristinely kept untouched. Someone later immortalized the Ed Gein story, albeit in a different name. Which name?

9. Norman Bates Robert Bloch wrote Psycho taking inspiration from Ed Gein. Later Hitchcock made the classic film.

10. Vijaya was a housewife from Chennai. On June 1988, she lodged an FIR with Thiruvanmiyur PS, South Chennai regarding the disappearance of her husband Sampath, along with two of his friends Mohan and Govindaraj. This FIR ultimately led to downfall of which drug kingpin cum serial killer who used to drive rickshaw in his earlier days?

11. Auto Shankar aka Gowri Shankar

12. Serial Killers generally use a pattern in their murders. Robert Hansen, an Alaskan serial killer of the 70s and early 80s, too had a technique of his own. All of his victims were dancers or prostitute, whom he used to overpower, rape and set free, even giving them a ride in his one-engine airplane. Then how did he killed them?

13. He used to hunt them down after dropping the victims in an Alaskan wilderness.

14. In the Buddhist literature, one can find out the story of Ahimsaka the serial killer. Coming from a family of untouchables, Ahimsaka set out to become a cruel brigand in his youth. Living in jungle near Kosala Kingdom, he used to murder and collect the fingers of his victims. He ultimately attained the blessings of Buddha, when Gautama visited his forest. By which name we better know Ahimsaka?

15. Aṅgulimāla

16. Connect:

17. Clockwise from top left: Binoy Majumdar Michael Modhu Soodan Dutt RNT Jibanananda Das Sukumar Ray Shakti Chatterjee In Bengali thriller Baishey Shrabon (2011), the killer chose to kill on the birthdays of Bengali poets, leaving a couple of lines of the poet.

18. Seema Gavit and Renuka Shinde are sisters who killed six children between1990 and 96. Along with their mother Anjana, the sisters used to run a pick pocketing ring. And kidnapped over 40 children to be used in the racket. Many of them didn't returned. Since 2014, the sisters are in news for a certain status they have. What?

19. They are the only women in the death row in the history of Indian Judiciary. Their mercy petition was rejected by the then President Pranab Mukherjee in 2014.

20. When Hillside Stranglers- serial killer duo from Los Angeles- met a 24-years old woman Catherine, their first intention was to kill her like the rest. But they soon realised that she is the only child of a famous character actor X, and out of fear they let her go. Irony is that, X himself became famous after playing the role of a serial killer in Fritz Lang's M (1936). Later, X went to act in Casablanca (1940). Who was X?

21. Peter Lorre

22. Plot No: D-5, Sector-31, Noida, Uttar Pradesh The address became talk of the nation in the first decade of the century, when some gruesome thing were discovered in that house in a chilly afternoon of December. In which name, do we better remember the case?

23. Nithari Kand It was the house of Mohinder Singh Pandher and his servant Surinder Kohli who killed 19+ children between 2005-06.

24. Vlado Taneski was a Macedonian serial killer, who was convicted for killing three women between 2004-08. A journalist by profession, he turned to serial killing after being laid off from the paper he used to work. Known to be a mild-mannered guy round the corner with no criminal record, at first there were no suspicion upon him, until Taneski nailed his own coffin. Exactly what he did?

25. He wrote an investigative report upon the murders in such graphic details, mentioning that police got suspicious.

26. Stoneman Murders erupted in Calcutta on 4th of June in 1989. On that day, in the very early morning, one bootlegger (maker of illicit country liquor) woman was found dead in a lane near Laldighi. However, not a single mention will be found of the murder on the papers of 5th June. As the reporters might thought it is too trivial a news in respect of that day’s big breaking international story. All the dailies of 5th June put that overseas news on the front-page headlines Which news?

27. Tiananmen Square Massacres happened on the same day.

28. Dennis Rader was an American serial killer from Wichita Kansas, who infamously killed 10 people between 1975 and 1990. Rader used to write taunting letters to media after every murder, in one of which he identified his methods as BTK. Which later became a terminology to describes crimes of these nature. What’s the full form?

29. B = Bind T = Torture K = Kill

30. Often considered as the first ever woman serial killer of India, the exploits of this 19th century prostitute was recorded by Priyanath Mukhopadhyay in his Darogar Daptar (1896). Along with lover Kalibabu, she used to kill her clients in the 1850s Kolkata before robbing them. Actress Jaya Ahsan will portray her in a yet to be finished web-series. Who?
